The first part of the chapter on spiritual communication, the sixth part, biographies of fifteen people, with three people mentioned in passing. The biography of Shi Tanqishi of Xiliangfu in the Later Wei Dynasty. Shi Tanqishi, also known as Huifeng, was not known where he was from.
Although he shaved his head, he was unrestrained and had no rules. He drank alcohol, ate meat, and spoke and remained silent without regularity.
If one asked about future events, he would later speak as if it were so.
He lived in Wuping and let his mind run wild.
At that time, Yuwen Zhonghe was the prefect and invited him to enter the prefecture to inspect the stables and storehouses, saying:
Why do you keep other official property?
Zhonghe did not understand his meaning and was angry, not allowing him to stay in the city.
Not long after, Zhonghe refused to accept the position, and Chao Yanling's envoy Dugu Xin captured him.
Zhonghe died, and his property was confiscated by the government.
When Zhou Wen heard about this, he sent a letter inviting him.
Dantuo arrived at Qizhou. Coincidentally, Qi Shenwu came to attack Yubi. Dantuo said:
How can a dog reach Dragon Gate?
Sure enough, Shenwu did not reach Dragon Gate and returned.
Before Hou Jing rebelled against the Eastern Wei, he suddenly grabbed a staff, the head of which was carved into the shape of a monkey, and made it always face west, playing with it day and night.
He also asked for a corner bow and pulled it.
Soon, Hou Jing requested to surrender, but then betrayed and returned to the Liang. All of this could be verified.
In the first month of spring in the seventeenth year of the Datong era, he suddenly put on a cloth hat.
Zhou Wen's attendants were surprised and asked him about it. Dantuo said:
You should also wear it, and the king should also wear it.
In the third month, Emperor Wen of Wei passed away.
He then took a white silk hat and put it on. The people around him asked him again.
Duan Te said:
You should also wear it, and so should the king.
Later, the wife of Wei Ji, the prime minister, passed away.
Later, he put it on again, and the answers were the same as before. Soon, the second son of the prime minister, the Marquis of Wuyun, passed away.
The events were often verified like this.
Soon, he fell ill and died. Emperor Wen of Zhou ordered him to be buried.
The Biography of He Tuoshi, the Monk from Jin Yanghe in the Later Wei Dynasty, the Biography of He Tuoshi, the Monk from Jin Yanghe in the Later Wei Dynasty, Shi He Tuoshi was from an unknown place.
During the Xiaochang period of the Wei Dynasty, he traveled in the markets of Jin Yanghe, sometimes acting foolish and sometimes wise, taking on the appearance of a monk.
At that time, people did not understand him and just called him the Monk from Yanghe.

When the second son of Emperor Shenwu of the Northern Qi, Yang, the future Emperor Wenxuan, was born, Empress Dowager Wuming saw that his family was very poor and discussed the family's finances with her relatives, saying, We are just worried about starving to death!
Yang Fang was born a few months ago and was not yet able to speak, but suddenly he said:
I am alive!
These two words were clear.
The empress dowager's attendants were greatly surprised, but did not dare speak, thinking it was a monster.
At that time, it was rumored that the shaven-headed master had supernatural powers and often hit the mark. He skillfully enticed them to come.
The empress dowager thought that her son's early speech was strange, so she visited all her sons - Wen Xiang, Wei Yongxi's empress - and asked them about it with rewards and positions.
When she reached Yang, he raised his hand twice and pointed to the sky, but did not speak.
It was as if the other sons had no gestures at all.
Later, his end was unknown.
Biography of Xuan Guang of the Chen Dynasty's Silla Kingdom Biography of Xuan Guang of the Chen Dynasty's Silla Kingdom: Shi Xuan Guang was a person from Xiong Prefecture in the East Sea.
From a young age, he was intelligent and suddenly disgusted with worldly dust. He resolutely sought a famous teacher to specialize in pure conduct.
When he grew up, he wished to cross the vast ocean to seek the Chan teachings of the Central Kingdom.
Thus, he visited the Chen state and went to Mount Heng to see the great master of thought. He opened up the world and accomplished transformation, with his spiritual understanding intermingling.
The master of thought observed his reasons and secretly bestowed the Practice of Peace and Bliss in the Lotus Sutra.
His benefits were like a divine awl, piercing through all that is solid;
New, like a piece of cloth, all that it touches becomes fresh.
He received and upheld it, diligently and without error, and suddenly realized the samadhi of the Lotus Sutra. He requested confirmation.
The master of thought certified it for him:
What you have realized is true and not false. Protect it well and let the Dharma grow.
When you return to your homeland, set up skillful means. Be good at carrying the cicada larvae, and they will all become cicada shells.
Guang bowed and wept. From then on, he returned to Jiangnan.

When the ship of his home country was loaded, as it left the shore, colorful clouds confused the eyes, elegant music boiled in the air, and crimson-knotted banners and pennants arrived with announcements.
A voice in the sky said:
The Heavenly Emperor summons Chan Master Xuan Guang of the East Sea.
Guang cupped his hands and yielded, only seeing a blue-robed attendant leading the way. In a short while, he entered the palace city, which was not a human official residence.
The arrangements of feathered guards were all scales and shells, mixed with ghosts and spirits.
Some said:
Today the Heavenly Emperor descended to the Dragon King's palace, invited the master to speak on the Dharma gate of personal realization, and we water palaces were benefited by the master.
After ascending the jeweled hall and then climbing the high terrace, as if asking and discussing, it was roughly seven days.
Then the king personally saw him off. The ship floated on the ocean and did not move forward.
Guang boarded the ship again, and the sailors said it had only been half a day.
Guang returned to Mount Ong in Xiong Prefecture, planted his staff, and built a thatched hut, which then became a Buddhist temple.
Those who attained the Dharma responded in unison, like hibernating insects emerging from their burrows;
Those who enjoyed the small and turned their minds, longing for the stench, suddenly arrived like a swarm of ants.

As for those who ascended the hall and received the prediction, one person entered the samÄdhi of the fire light, one person entered the samÄdhi of the water light, and the two of them mutually attained the two kinds of Dharma gates.
The name of the samÄdhi is derived from what they emitted.
The disciples, for example, are like many birds perched on Mount Sumeru, all becoming the same color.
The extinction of the light at the end, one does not know where it went.
The ancestral hall constructed by the patriarchs of Nanyue depicts twenty-eight people, and Guang is one of them.
The ancestral hall of Tiantai Guoqing Temple is also like this.
The author says:
In sum, after the Buddha's extinction, examining those who entered the Way, using the four dharmas of teaching, principle, practice, and fruition to clarify it, then there is nowhere to hide!
Those who are closer to the Sage are those whose practice is accomplished and whose fruition stage is realized;
Those who are further away from the Sage are easy to teach and see the principle directly;
Those who are even more distant learn the teachings without refinement and do not see the principle accurately.
If a single thought is not produced, the past and future are cut off, this is the sudden mind becoming Buddha.
The principle Buddha is fully endowed with practice, but the practice Buddha has never been mentioned.
The essence is complete but subtle:
In China since the Sixth Patriarch, many have talked about Chan principles but few about Chan practice.
It is not that Nanyue did not speak of practice, but he wanted people to see the Way as if saving their head from fire.
Nanyue Si's emphasis was on combined cultivation, with both precepts and meditation urgent, thus his students verified the fruits of practice.
As for entering the samÄdhi of firelight, in the Sutra on Being in the Womb, it says to concentrate the mind in meditation and enter the samÄdhi of the fire element, and the world will be in flames.
Foolish people think it is being burned.
If one enters the samÄdhi of the water element, foolish people see it as water and throw things into it.
The bodhisattva's mind is like empty space, not aware of being touched or disturbed. This is not something that the two vehicles can fully comprehend.
This is urgent in the fruition of practice.

Shi Faxi, a person from the South Seas, had a very ugly appearance, was short and weak, and was slow-witted. He was about forty years old.

When I saw him as a child, his appearance is now the same as then, without any difference.

People also did not want to meet with Xi, fearing that he would speak directly about disasters and rebellious intentions.

During the Chen dynasty, Ma Jing served as the Prefect of Guangzhou. When he was about to take office, Xi went straight to the prefecture office, drew a horse's head on the ground, and left it as a warning to his son.

When he took office in the prefecture, whenever he went out, his retinue of armored soldiers numbered in the tens of thousands, with banners, swords, and halberds like rainbows and rain, saying that this could intimidate the border areas.

The Biography of Monk Qin of Mingzhou in the Sui Dynasty, Part 2 The Biography of Monk Qin of Mingzhou in the Sui Dynasty, Part 2. The monk Qin, whose place of origin is unknown,
During the Daye era, he arrived in Guangping. His appearance and spirit were strange and difficult to understand. His speech was not consistent, and he often went to the middle of the road.
He saw the five-story brick pagoda built by Lingtong Temple, which was intended to be tall and grand, with complicated construction.
Qin looked at it and laughed, saying to the temple congregation:
What is the purpose of building this?
The congregation said:
Meritorious deeds and Buddhist activities require grand and magnificent structures. Why do you, Dharma Master, ask such a strange question?
He laughed and said:
It's a beacon fire tower.
At that time, the monks criticized each other, saying:
The words of these crazy people are unacceptable!

By the ninth year, the pagoda was still not completed. Bandits arose in all four directions. The state officials were on high alert. They placed watchtowers and signal fires on the pagoda. Only then did they believe that the words of admiration were not false.
The elders at the site also did not know where admiration came from.
The place where he stayed also had no trace.
Then from time to time he transformed his body, in the pen of pigs, he immediately followed the group of rabbits.
Several people such as the young Ma Shidai saw the beginning of admiration's transformation. They then stayed and observed, intending to further observe his return to human form.
Later, he suddenly transformed again, and behind the onlookers, he shouted loudly, saying:
What do you all want to see?
The group of people were startled and bowed with palms joined.
His transformations were all like this.
When the world was in chaos, the sound and traces of admiration were also lost.
Xi said:
Why did the monks of Wei and Sui have many manifestations?
Tong said:
The bodhisattvas' activities, manifesting bodies according to the type [of being to be saved], take spiritual powers as their play.
In their play, they benefit the lords of the world.
Someone said:
Wei, Qi, Chen, Sui, and Xuan's teachers, their ears and eyes in contact, why are they not included in the Continued Biographies?
Tong replied:
There is something I do not know, it is truly lacking.
It is just like the great Song, whose written norms are the same, and whose territory is vast, with strange things happening every day, which is truly difficult to know completely.

Even if there is a certain monk, what can be done if the historian has not yet compiled it, and the transmission has no basis? Therefore, it is also lacking, and those that are not recorded will be left for later sages.

The Biography of Monk Sengjia of Puguangwang Temple in Sizhou of the Tang Dynasty, the Biography of Monk Sengjia of Puguangwang Temple in Sizhou of the Tang Dynasty, Mohe Zhiyan, Zhi'an Shi Sengjia was a person from He Country north of the Pamirs.
He said his secular surname was He, just like how Seng Hui was originally from Kang Ju country, so he was called Kang Seng Hui.
However, he should have had both a Hu and Sanskrit name. Since his name was in Sanskrit, his surname was in Chinese.
If one examines which country He was from, it is northeast of Sui Ye country, which is a vassal state of Sui Ye.
When Jia was young in his homeland, he left home to become a monk.
After becoming a monk, he vowed to travel to various places.
He first arrived in Xiliang Prefecture, and then traveled through the Jiang Huai area, during the early years of Longshuo.
He was registered at Longxing Temple in Shanyang, and from then on he began to show his supernatural abilities.
At first, he went to Linhuai with his disciple HuÃ¬yÇng, and asked the people of Xinyin Fang for land. He planted a marker and said that he would build a monastery at this place.
He then dug the ground and found an ancient stele, which was the Xiangji Temple of Qi country.
He found a golden image with the inscription Buddha of Universal Illumination on it. The people of the neighborhood marveled and said:
The heavenly eye sees first, how can we not abandon it?
The stele and statue were destroyed by two fires during the Zhenyuan and Longqing periods.
Once, while lying in the house of the He family, his body suddenly grew three feet longer than the bed and couch, causing everyone to be astonished.
Next, he manifested the form of the Eleven-Faced Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva. The entire family rejoiced and doubled their faith and respect, and eventually donated the house.
The foundation of Xiangji Temple is now the current temple.
Because of these extraordinary traces, the sprouts of faith continued to grow.

In the second year of Jinglong era of Emperor Zhongzong, an envoy was sent to invite him to the inner sanctuary. The emperor personally attended the Dharma assembly, and their conversation and discussions were like the fitting of a puzzle.
The emperor then praised the temple as the Temple of Universal Light.
In the fourth year, the gengxu year, he showed signs of illness and was ordered to move to Jianfusi Temple.
On the second day of the third month, he sat upright and passed away, his countenance as if alive, only his eyes were closed.
He was eighty-three years old in the secular world, but his years as a monk were unknown.
He spent thirty years in his home country and fifty-three years spreading the Dharma in the Tang.
The emperor was saddened and distressed.
At that time, a foul stench filled the air, yet his body remained as before, with many miraculous signs appearing.

The emperor ordered the authorities to provide three hundred bolts of silk to send him back for burial on the banks of the Huai River, and ordered the officials to escort him, with the common people filling the roads.
On the fifth day of the fifth month, he arrived at his present location.
The emperor, missing him and unable to forget, asked Master Wanhui:
Who was that monk Sengqie?
He replied:
He was an incarnation of Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva.
Isn't it said in the sutra?
For those who can be saved by the form of a monk, he manifests the appearance of a monk.
At first, Qie spread the Dharma in the Jiangnan area, staying at Lingguang Temple in Jiahe.
That place was a marshy country, where the people's fishing platforms and bow-nets were set up side by side.
Jia bitterly admonished them:
All these killing activities will lead people to fall into the hells. You should quickly find another way to make a living.
At that time, many people unraveled their nets and broke their fishing poles.
Jia sat quietly to rest, and saw a spirit tell him:
The heavens are now suffering from drought, and the people's crops are dying. What are you hiding, lazy dragon?
Jia said:
What can be done about it?
The spirit said:
If you just stick your finger out of the window tonight, what will people do?
Jia followed it, and that night the thunder struck as usual. The next morning, he looked at his finger, and there was a slight red thread-like pulse.
Jia said:
I have no affinity with this place.
He then went to Jinling and saw that Guoxiang Temple was in ruins. He left his robe on the temple beam and left. Later, people smelled a fragrant scent.
Jia once recorded it, saying:ğŸ”½In the past, I was a dragon in the Qiantang River.
The temple will be restored by a 'human king'.
Thirty years later, there was indeed a monk and layperson surnamed Quan who became a patron.
In the Tongtian Wansui year, among the crowd in Shanyang, he secretly knew that Jia was despised. He then said:
I have 500,000 coins to contribute to the merit, do not give rise to slander.
Jia called out to a boat on the shore of the Huai River, saying:
If you give me your wealth, you can avoid punishment.
What you are carrying is only what you have plundered.
The thief gave everything as instructed, and the Buddha hall was thus established.
Before long, the thief was captured in the prison of Yangzi County.
Jia rode on clouds down to comfort him, saying:
Do not suffer.
Before long, an amnesty document arrived and he was spared from death.
In the past, when the son-in-law and Cavalry General Wu Youji was ill in Chang'an, Jia sprinkled water from his ritual vessel on him and he was cured. His fame shook the capital.
Later, if someone was ill, they would tell them to either brush with willow branches or wash the stone lion, which would cure them. Sometimes they would throw water jars or have them apologize.
The tests were not false, and the efforts were not wasted.
To ward off physical disasters, they would seek horses;
To warn of wind calamities, they would ask for fans.

Sometimes they would recognize the money of a thief, sometimes they would bite the neck of a black rope, sometimes they would search for an arhat's well, sometimes they would awaken to Pei's drowning, sometimes they would foreknow heavy snow, sometimes they would save from drought and flying rain.
The spiritual transformations were boundless, and the measurements were not the usual standards.
The Middle Sovereign decreed to grant three disciples - Huian, Huijing, and Mucha - each with robes and alms bowls, to continue the incense and fire.
After his extinction, many years passed. He once manifested his form to go to Hanshui Market to buy lacquerware.
When the merchant Li Shanyin's boat arrived at the temple, he looked for a monk to buy ritual vessels.
Suddenly he saw an image in the stupa, motionless, pointing and saying:
Only this monk came to seek to buy it!
People from far and near sighed in admiration.
He also once transformed timber at Hongjing, tied rafts, and arrived there.
During the Dali period, the state general ordered the temple to manage ten post stations, forcing him to provide funds for carriages and horses.
In the fifteenth year, on the night of the jia hour in the seventh month, he manifested his form in the inner palace, begging to be exempted from the duties of post stations.

Emperor Dezong ordered the eunuch Ma Fengcheng to proclaim the release, and also presented him with three hundred bolts of silk, one thousand pieces of miscellaneous silk, a golden washbasin, and a robe of the crown prince, ordering him to copy the portrait and enshrine it in the inner palace for worship.
Again, during the Qianyuan period, the state governor Li Wuming had an astrologer say:
As the earth star is added, the disaster will be evil and weak.
Jia suddenly manifested his form, patted Li's back and said:
I have come, and blessings have arrived. Sweat has dispelled the disaster.
Later, there were no other faults.
He once asked the Yan army for felt and felt rugs, claiming to be a monk from a temple in Si Prefecture.
The Yan envoy brought the requested items and recognized the statue in the pagoda. It was true!
He then drew the statue and returned.
From Yan and Ji, it spread and was copied everywhere.
In the first year of the Longqing era, in the middle of the night, in front of the sleeping quarters of the prefect Su, he sang:
South of the Huai River and north of the Huai River, blessings will come from here.
From east to west, there will be no place untouched.
That year, only the Huai River region had a good harvest.
In the second year, the pagoda of the temple was burned, but only the statue of the Buddha remained intact as if undamaged.
In the Xianqing era, Pang Xun, originally a garrison soldier in Xuzhou, took advantage of the chaos in the Gui region and plundered along the way to attack Si Prefecture, laying siege to the city.
The Buddha appeared on top of the pagoda, and the foreign invaders all fell asleep. The city occasionally sent troops to attack them, and they fled in surprise and fell into Xuzhou.
The matter was reported to the emperor, and he bestowed the title of Great Master of Verified Sagehood upon him.
In the first year of the Wende era, foreign invaders encroached, and the state general laid siege to the enemy in the city.
Jia manifested his form in the northwest corner of the city.
The invaders saw it and knew that the fortress was difficult to take down, so they were startled and fled in the night.

During the Dachuang era, the commander of Pengmen ordered Zhang Jian to attack the northern city. Besides the killing, more than five hundred people were captured and interrogated in the field. As Jian leaned on the desk, he suddenly saw a monk in purple robes admonishing him, saying:
These are ordinary people, how can they be killed?
It is better to let them go.
After saying this, he disappeared.
Jian then released them, and they escaped.
In the first year of the Qianning era, the prefectural governor Meng dreamed that Jia said:
In the southeast, there is little preparation for the cold.
Meng did not understand the meaning, so he donated cotton quilts and Dharma robes to him.
On the night of the last day of the twelfth month, soldiers scaled the ramparts and entered the city. Meng did not know about it at first.
He also dreamed of a monk placing a tin staff on his heart, which penetrated to the bone, and woke up in shock.
He was ordered to move the drum and horn, and the thieves were startled and fled. The leader with the surname Han was captured. Only then did he understand.
Because of this, he often appeared in the form of a small monk on top of the pagoda, attracting people from the entire prefecture to look up at him.
However, there were signs of good and bad fortune. At that time, those who begged for wind were given wind, and those who sought sons obtained sons.
Now, I hear that those who personally pay homage to him often do not see the appearance of the Buddha at all.
If they see him smiling, it is good, otherwise it is bad. The unpredictable is like this.

When the Emperor of the Zhou Dynasty had matters in the south of the Yangtze River, he first attacked and captured Sushan. The Buddha appeared in the dreams of the people of the prefecture, saying that the enemy should not be taken lightly.
In this way, it reached the governor of the prefecture, but they did not believe it.
From then on, family after family had the same dream, and they told each other. They finally surrendered, and the people of the entire prefecture were protected by the Buddha.
Wherever a hermitage was built in the world, a statue of the Great Sage Sangha Master was erected, with the signboard saying Great Sage Sangha Master.
Many people's wishes were fulfilled when they made requests.
Li Beihai Yong and Hu Zhuke Hao each wrote inscriptions to praise his virtues.

In the reign of the current emperor, he focused his mind on this. In the third month of that year, a nun returned from visiting the Five Terrace Mountains and saw Sangha on the top of the pagoda, acting like a child. She then climbed the pagoda pole and offered her body and life as worship.
In the seventh year of the Taiping Xingguo era, the emperor ordered Gao Pin Bai Cheng to re-cover the pagoda, making it taller and adding more layers.
In the eighth year, an envoy was sent to separately deliver relics and treasures to be buried together in the lower foundation.
On that day, a monk named Huai De preemptively built a wooden tower and held a wax torch himself to burn his body as an offering.
Amidst the conflagration, the sound of sutras never ceased.
Moreover, when about to build a pagoda, there were three large logs floating down the Huai River, stopping near the floating bridge, and were collected to be the central pillars of the pagoda.
Later, the imperial edict ordered Gao Pin Li Tingxun, the head of the palace, to oversee the construction.
Previously, the temple was named after a golden statue found in the foundation, with the Buddha inscribed as Universal Illumination King, thus becoming the temple's name.
Later, to avoid the imperial name of Empress Wu Zetian, the character guang was replaced with pu.
Recently, the imperial court requested the Seng Jia Shi Lu, which the emperor read and returned the original name of the temple as Universal Illumination King Temple.
The disciple Mu Cha, whose name is in the language of the Western Regions, means liberation in Chinese.
Since childhood, he followed Jia as a disciple to shave his head, and then often manifested spiritual wonders.
In the fourth year of Zhonghe, the Prefect Liu Ran, whose father was the Vice-Prefect, suddenly dreamed of a purple-robed monk who said:
I have a disciple Mu Cha buried to the west of the temple for a long time!
Can you take it out?
He then showed him the burial site.

At first, the dream did not matter, but the second dream was the same as the first. The Vice-Prefect obtained the place indicated in the dream and wanted to dig it up, but he saw that a surname occupied it, so he bought it with money.
When the hole was opened to about three feet, he obtained a sitting coffin, and then opened it. On the bones there was a relic emitting light.

He ordered it to be burned and collected over eight hundred relics, which he presented to Emperor Xizong. The emperor decreed that the ashes from the burning be used to sculpt an image, and also bestowed the posthumous title of True Appearance Great Master.
It still stands to the left today, as if in a paired offering.

The disciple Huiguo, whose surname and birthplace are unknown, always followed his teacher Sengqie and served him, carrying his water and carrying his luggage. He left from Chuzhou and arrived at Huaiyin, together encouraging the Hai Dong Pei Sima - his wife was stingy with white gold and pearls and they fell into the water.
Arriving at Xuyi, he opened the Arhat Well and stayed at the home of He Ba Xuanji, with the Eleven-Faced Guanyin Bodhisattva standing by.
From then on, he was ordered to go to the capital with the monks.

Huian was by nature magnanimous and did not get tainted by worldly dust. He studied the Dharma gates and was well-versed in all of them.

During the Daye era, the Tongji Canal was opened, and laborers were conscripted. Starving corpses were seen everywhere.
An traveled around begging for many bowls of food, saving the sick and the hungry, and many were saved.

An knew that the conditions for rebirth in the Western Pure Land were ripe. He told his disciples:
I am now going to be reborn. Who can go with me?
A young boy bowed and said:
I wish to follow the master.

He then ordered him to take leave of his parents. His parents thought he was joking, so they had him bathe and put on clean clothes, and enter the ritual arena to recite the Buddha's name. In a short while, he passed away.
An said to him:
How could you go ahead?
At that time, An requested a brush and praised the two Bodhisattvas, saying:
Avalokitesvara assists from afar, Samantabhadra aids from afar, the jeweled vase is evident on the crown, the transformed Buddha is clear in front of the head.
Together they roam the lands of the ten directions, holding flowers to await the nine lives.
I wish with the hand of compassion to encourage and accompany them to the west.

After composing the praise, he took leave of his disciples and entered the ritual arena. He ordered his disciples to assist him in reciting the Buddha's name, and then sat upright and passed away, at the age of eighty.
This was on the seventh day of the first month in the first year of the Dui-gong era.

The Biography of the Later Monk Hui of Yongxin Temple in Kuaiji, Tang Dynasty The Biography of the Later Monk Hui of Yongxin Temple in Kuaiji, Tang Dynasty. Monk Hui, originally from Kangju, visited the Great Emperor in the Wu era of the Red Sparrow.
At first, the people of Wu did not recognize the appearance of monks, so they called them Hu people entering the realm.
Then, after praying for the relics, they made the emperor enlightened.
In the fourth year of Tianji of the last ruler, his body dissolved, and the true body disappeared.

In the Yongå¾½ era of the Tang Dynasty Gaozong, his form was seen in Yue, claiming to be a monk traveling around, and his spiritual energy was extraordinary, with high eyebrows, a prominent chin, and blue eyes, and he was thin with strange bones, truly a Brahmanic appearance.
Those who saw him were awestruck, not knowing his rank.
At that time, the abbot questioned him and scolded him, driving him away.
When Hui was about to leave, he said:
I am Kang Senghui. If you can keep my true body, it will be a blessing for your monastery.
In the time it takes to walk, he stood and his breath ceased.
Then, with slightly closed blue eyes, his spirit did not fade. Raising his hand was like welcoming, and his feet seemed to want to walk.
The crowd discussed how to enshrine his sacred body, and buried it in a tomb, exhausting human strength, but it barely moved.
Although the physical body was firm, they used strong glue and lacquer to move it to a superior place and separately established a lofty hall.
At that time, the people of Yue competed in offering incense, flowers, lamps, silk, canopies, fruits, clothes, and utensils, praying for their wishes, and often in accord with people's intentions.
At first, the military troops of Yue often stayed in Yongxin, and the wives and children gave birth. The soldiers' raw blood polluted the monastic grounds, and people could not bear the filth.
Hui then transformed his appearance and visited Li Ruochu, the magistrate of Min, saying:
You are now in charge of the border area of Yue, and I entrust you to move the military troops.
After speaking, he shook his sleeves and left, soon losing his trace.
Magistrate Li was delighted and shocked, and remembered his words. Later, he indeed went to that prefecture.
After the matter above was finished, he visited the spiritual traces. The one who recognized the words from that time was this monk.
He ordered the army to be withdrawn and set up camp.
Also, a pregnant woman was about to give birth at night, and there was no oil lamp. The neighboring houses had no light.
Suddenly a monk brought a lamp and entered through the window.
The husband entered Yongxin in the morning and recognized the appearance of the assembly, which was the monk who gave the lamp to save the woman in childbirth.
Since then, many people in the villages have come to request sons and daughters.
When Yongxin was destroyed during the Huichang period, only the present Dashi was left, called Kaiyuan, and Hui moved his body into this temple.
After the Daming period, Vinaya Master Tanhui built a hall for Hui separately and expanded his offerings.

He also once went to the houses of the common people to request straw sandals. Many people in Yue now offer oil banners with rattan sandals. The responses to the prayers vary, each going to people's homes, which cannot be described in detail.
He is now called the Great Master of Transcendent Transformation.
From the Yong-hui era to the present, the offerings have never been interrupted.
The monk Xu Shou wrote a stele inscription to record it.
The author says:
Cai Yong was Zhang Heng's reincarnation, and Zhiwei was originally Xu Ling's past life. The evidence is all clear, and the principle is not false.
As for the sages' power to act freely, this one disappears and the other appears, benefiting without bounds.
Since Seng Hui left the world long ago, his teachings have spread beyond the Tang. He passed away standing upright, an anomaly among anomalies.
If it were not for manifesting forms in response to beings, like the moon in water, who could have foreseen this?
Biography of Dao Ying of Fahai Temple in Jingzhao during the Tang Dynasty, Biography of Dao Ying of Fahai Temple in Jingzhao during the Tang Dynasty. Shi Dao Ying, whose place of origin is unknown,
was fully virtuous in observing the precepts and his reputation spread throughout the capital. He resided at the temple in Buzheng Lane.
During the Xianheng era, ghosts and spirits were seen. The abbot Huijian once said:
I saw two people walking without touching the ground, entering Ying's courtyard.
He asked the strange man, and Ying said:

The Qin King Zhuang Xiang sent a messenger to deliver a message saying, I have been hungry for a very long time. With your great compassion, I hope you will provide food for me and my three hundred followers. Please do not decline out of fatigue.
I replied, saying, Tomorrow morning I will prepare a feast. You can come and I will personally wait on you.
Jian heard this and said to help with the wine.
When the time came, he really came, with a very strict retinue. While sitting and eating, he looked pale and yellow, and said to Ying:
I have not eaten for eighty years.
Ying asked the reason, and he replied:
Since my birth, I have not been without mistakes. As for destroying the Eastern Zhou and ending the Ji clan's sacrifices,

some blame me for my merits and demerits. In my daily life, I have not had Buddhism to repent and transcend. I can only use pardons, sympathy, and pity to make up for it, but in the end it is not enough.
With little blessings and many sins, I have not finished receiving retribution.
Now, for this one meal, I will not eat again for another forty years.
He then pointed to the seats above and said:
This is Bai Qi and Wang Jian, who killed many people, and their punishment has not yet ended.
He also said:
This is Chen Zhen, because of his deception.
Ying said:
Why don't you ask people for food and endure hunger? How can this be tolerated?
The king said:
People with compassion are few, and other people do not see each other.
I am a noble person, and I cannot rashly bring disaster, that is why.
Ying pointed to the wine and said:
The abbot Jian Gong is about to offer it.
He felt deeply ashamed.
As he was about to leave, he said to Ying:
I am very grateful for this visit and the sumptuous feast. You should know that I will send you some small items to repay you.
Outside the Tong Huamen in the east of the city, there is a pointed mound - because it is tall and large with a sharp top - this is where I will rest my spirit.
Worldly people do not know, falsely calling it the tomb of LÃ¼ Buwei.
Ying said:
In the past, the Red Eyebrows opened it up. What treasures are there?
He said:
The bandits could not take it.
Ying said:
I am not a tomb robber, I am a monk, with no use for treasures. Do not bring them.
After speaking, he bowed and left.
Ying's feelings for the lower realms were like this, and he did not know the end.
The Biography of Dharma Xiu of Jingzhao in the Tang Dynasty, the Biography of Dharma Xiu of Jingzhao in the Tang Dynasty, Shi Dharma Xiu, whose place of origin is unknown.
He lived in a temple in the capital and traveled between Xian and Hao, often leading many people to do good deeds, never resting even in old age.
At the end of the Kaiyuan era, he dreamed of a person saying:
Bring five hundred towels and five hundred kaá¹£Äya robes to donate at the Huixiang Temple.
Later, Jue asked those around him, and they all said there was no Huixiang Temple.
When he recruited people to make the towels and robes, and inquired about old monks and laypeople everywhere, none knew of such a monastery.
At that time, there was a monk with a large and sturdy physique, whom no one recognized. He said:
I know the location of the Huixiang Temple.
When asked what was needed and who were the companions, he replied:
Just bring the donated goods and one jin of famous incense, that will be sufficient.
So he followed his words and gave the goods, and went together with Xiu.
The monk went straight into Zhongnan Mountain. After about two days of travel, they reached an extremely deep and steep place, with nothing to be seen.
Continuing on, they saw a set of millstones and were surprised, saying:
How could there be such a thing in a place where human footsteps do not reach?
He then burned the incense he had brought on top of the cliff, made prostrations again and again, and lamented. From noon until evening,

the valley was filled with mist, and one could not see anything within a few feet. After a while, the mist cleared, and on the side of the cliff, there was a vermilion gate with powdered walls, green windows, and jade-colored inscriptions. The banners of the pagoda flew high, and the eaves of the building cast sharp shadows.
After a short while, he saw a temple clearly on the edge of the clouds, with a giant plaque hanging at the gate that read Temple of Turning the Mind.
Xiu and the monk were overjoyed. They climbed up and finally reached the temple. It was already dusk, and they heard the sound of bells, chimes, and chanting.
The gatekeeper asked where they came from, and after some delay, he led them in to see an old monk who welcomed them with repeated inquiries and said:
Is the Tang Emperor in good health?
He instructed another monk to accompany them, and they went through the rooms, distributing towels and robes, except for one set.
He pointed to an empty bed in a room with no one, with clothes and bedding, as if someone had just left.
Then he saw the old monk - perhaps the head of the monastery - and said:
The one who went out should be back by now.
The monk and Xiu wanted to go there to give him a towel and other things.
The room with only an empty bed was also empty.
Again, they told the old monk in detail, and the old monk smiled and told them to sit down. He looked inside the room and took out a sheng, which turned out to be a jade sheng.
The old monk said:
Have you seen that foreign monk?
They said:
We have seen him.
The old monk said:
This is the one who will temporarily replace your lord in the future.
The capital will be in chaos and countless people will die.
This foreigner is called the King of Destruction.
That empty room is your lord's room.
Your master is in the temple, playing the flute out of love. The punishment is in the human realm, and this is what he always plays.
Now the time limit is almost over, he will return soon.
The next day, he was sent to the vegetarian feast. After the feast, he said:
You should return, take this flute, and the monk's robe and towel, and give them to your master yourself.
Xiu bowed and returned. The boy saw him off. After only a few dozen steps, the clouds and mist suddenly closed in, and he could no longer see the temple.
He then presented the towel, monk's robe, and jade flute to the emperor. Xuanzong summoned him and fully recounted the details.
The emperor was greatly moved and concentrated his spirit for a long time. He took the flute and played it, and it was indeed the same one he had used before.
Several years later, there was indeed the calamity of An Lushan. The Hu monk that Xiu saw was An Lushan.
Xiu was moved by what he encountered, and his diligence doubled. It is unknown where he ended up.
It is said that there is also a dedication at the Holy Temple on Mount Zhongnan.
The author says:

In the past, Emperor Wu of Liang sent a robe to the mountain by the sea, Fashou went to Huixiang Temple, and Master Yan ordered an envoy to search for the Holy Bamboo Grove Temple. These three events have different names but the same matter. Could it be that they are mutually modified, like cutting a crane and extending a duck?
The author replies:

The works of the sages are like making a cart inside a gate, and the tracks outside the gate match. Even if it is a distance of thousands of miles, the matter is also in agreement. It is because there is no different path.
Therefore, it is like a woodcutter watching a fairy chess game. The rotten axe handle is not just for Wang Zhi.
There are many people who encounter chess, and their names are not the same. Those who use rotten axes and handles are not one.
Now, sending many robes to the Holy Temple is also like this.

Biography of Puming of Longxing Temple in Huazhou during the Tang Dynasty Biography of Puming of Longxing Temple in Huazhou during the Tang Dynasty Shi Puming, whose place of origin is unknown, is said to be a monk from the Western Regions.
Whenever he talked about Chan teachings and raised profound and subtle points, no one could fathom his profound and lofty [understanding].
In the first year of Dali, he accepted an invitation from the people of Zhixian County to reside in a forest hermitage, and students gathered like ants.
Those who came and went in the dust, laypeople who paid homage to him and made offerings to him, numbered in the thousands every day.

Some, upon merely seeing his appearance, naturally restrained anger and suppressed desires, ate fruit, and carried the sound [of the Dharma]. Following goodness and reforming evil, there were countless such people over the years.
Jia Dan, the right attendant and military commissioner of Yicheng Army, who was originally an exiled immortal, roamed in the study of the Way and generally disregarded the Buddhist gate.
As soon as he met Puming, it was like Yang Hu recognizing an old ring or Cai Shun seeing his kind mother.
He was invited to stay at the state temple, and the streets were empty of people as everyone came out to welcome him.
Thus, he taught the Dharma to people, never tiring even in old age.
He moved as fast as the wind, and his physical appearance was light and strong.
In the twelfth month of the intercalary year of the ninth cycle of the sexagenary cycle, the eighth year of the Zhenyuan era, he entrusted his disciples and peacefully passed away sitting.
Some say he lived for three hundred years, because those who saw him at the age of one hundred did not see any change in his appearance.
